intro: Dianthus monspessulanus var. correvonis, commonly known as the Corsican campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Corsica. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features basal rosettes of velvety, silver-green leaves and produces clusters of pink or red, five-petaled flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal environments. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
